Pre-Game Insights: India will be facing England in the Semi-Final 2 of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, 2024 at the Guyana National Stadium on June 27 at 08:00 PM IST.
In their last five head-to-head encounters, India dominated in three matches while England won two games.
The average first-innings score at the Guyana National Stadium in the last 20 matches is 150 runs.
The pitch at the Guyana National Stadium is a sporting one with decent assistance for both batters and bowlers.
The temperature is expected to be around 28 degrees Celsius with 77% humidity and light rain expected which may affect playing conditions.
In the 23 matches played between India and England, the bowlers of both teams have earned the most fantasy points for their respective teams.
Hardik Pandya is a safe bet for your Fantasy Team with an average of 64 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 9.1.
Jasprit Bumrah has an average of 62 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 8.3.
Jos Buttler is a wicket-keeper with an average of 59 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 8.7.
Rishabh Pant is a wicket-keeper batter with an average of 57 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 8.3.
Chris Jordan can be a good pick for your Dream11 Team with an average of 56 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 8.4.
Suryakumar Yadav is a middle-order batter with an average of 49 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 8.7.
Kuldeep Yadav has an average of 48 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 8.5.
Sam Curran has an average of 46 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 7.3.
Shivam Dube has an average of 32 fantasy points in the last 10 games and a fantasy rating of 7.2.

India's possible playing XI includes Rohit Sharma (captain), Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant (wicketkeeper), Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Arshdeep Singh, Kuldeep Yadav, and Jasprit Bumrah.

England's possible playing XI includes Phil Salt, Jos Buttler (captain and wicketkeeper), Jonny Bairstow, Moeen Ali, Harry Brook, Liam Livingstone, Sam Curran, Jofra Archer, Adil Rashid, Chris Jordan, and Reece Topley.
